body.name: RETTACY Dotted Bullet Grid Journal 2 Pack - A5 Dot Grid Leather Hardcover Notebook with 320 Pages, 120 GSM Premium Acid-Free Paper, Back Pocket, 5.75'' × 8.38'' (Black & Black)

features: 【BULLET DOTTED JOURNAL】- RETTACY Bullet Dotted Journal comes in a A5 (5.75'' x 8.38'') size, 2-Pack, 80 Sheets/160 Pages per pack, total 160 Sheets/320 Pages, durable and silky Leather Hard Cover, 120 GSM Acid-free Paper, Back Pocket, Bullet Journaling Stencil, 2 Ribbon Bookmarks & Elastic Cosure Band

【120 GSM PREMIUM PAPER】- 120 GSM paper is thicker, sturdier, and will stand up to the test of time. Whether you're jotting down your thoughts, ideas, or memories, our journal will ensure that your words are preserved in tip-top condition, let your words flourish on high-quality paper. You can confidently use most pens, pencils and markers without ghosting and bleed-through

【ACID-FREE PAPER】- Due to its lack of acidic components, it can preserve documents for a long time without corrosion or deterioration, ensuring the long-term preservation of documents. Secondly, acid-free paper has a higher quality and excellent writing performance, providing a clear and uniform writing surface that makes text easier to read

【LEATHER HARDCOVER】- RETTACY Bullet Dotted Journal's cover is made of silky, leather hardcover, offering a sturdy protection for your precious entries. With this exquisite cover, you can rest assured that your journal will be a cherished keepsake for years to come
【VIBRANT & BOLD COLORS】- Whether you prefer vibrant hues or more subtle shades, we've got you covered. Don't blend in, stand out with bright colors!

Great for Bullet Journaling Convenient to Carry Various Colors for You

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I buy dot grid journals for studying and hobby journaling. I prefer a dot grid in case I want to draw quick comic panels or I need to break up a space into smaller chunks of information. Since I have tried a lot of brands, here's how this one compares to my favorite cheap brand to buy on Amazon:- The Cover: This journal's cover is made of a flexible and squishy faux leather with hard covers and a soft spine. It feels and acts like it's more premium than my usual journal, however it came with some dents embedded in the cover, probably from something heavy placed over it for too long. Since I plan to paint onto this cover, it's not an ideal situation. But since it's cheap, this is actually less issues than expected. It's common for me to find weird markings and dents on cheap journals, even if I go to a store in-person.- The Pages: This paper is a soft ivory color that's easy on the eyes. There's 160 total pages - 3 for the index, 1 blank page, and 156 numbered pages. What surprises me is when comparing the 120 GSM page (this journal) to a 100 GSM page (usual journal). While this one is slightly more opaque, the amount of ghosting is about the same. My usual tools are a Tombow marker and a gel pen. All marks and colors will show to the other side, but not so strongly that I can't write over it. However, it does bleed through completely if I press a dot into the paper. You will need to press lightly on your markers. I do not recommend this journal for coloring directly onto the paper, you'll want a 160 GSM journal which can handle ink better. However, I think this paper is fine for general writing or for sketching without color. There's not a big enough difference for me to prefer 120 GSM over 100 GSM.-The Construction: It lays flat. I tugged at the pages, elastic, and ribbons, and I am only concerned about the pen loop, so that part should be handled with some care. This book is pretty lightweight for a hardcover, but slightly heavier than my usual. My main issue is with the opening page. With most journals like this, there is a sheet of cardstock over the seams of the cover sheet. The first page is glued directly onto this cardstock in a way that you can't fully open the page, you have to crease it about a half inch from the spine so it opens flat. Usually, I skip or glue down the page completely so I don't have to crease the page to use it. But in this journal, this page is also an index page. It bothers me to have to use this section, but you might find you don't care. It depends how much the extra index page means to you.- Extras: This journal comes with a pen loop, two ribbons, a title page, three dedicated index pages, 156 numbered pages, a pocket in the back cover, some stencils, and a band to hold the book closed. My usual has much fewer extras. I would say this one is definitely a plus for anyone who wants to dive straight into journaling without having to worry about page numbers or index pages. The stencils are nice if you need to repeatedly use symbols.Overall, I feel this journal is a good competitor to my usual brand for general writing or studying. I personally don't find the pages sturdy enough for coloring with markers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 120 GSM will give ghosting…Recommend for first journaling experiences
reviews.reviewText: Excellent price. Great notebooks, quality look and feel. Paper is nice and smooth. If you’re just getting started with journaling and you’re using ballpoint, rollerball, and or fine and extra fine fountain pensyou’ll be fine. If you’re going to get into more heavy pens, markers, and detailed stuff, you will get ghosting. Which is fine if you’re just starting your practice. It’s a great notebook to experiment and get over perfectionism in your journal practice.Go for it! It’s just a notebook and it is yours. Don’t worry about mistakes it’s about what your intentions are, not how pretty or perfect it looks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I never leave amazon reviews..so read this
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this journal. I never leave Amazon reviews but I decided I have to for this because this is the exact journal I needed to design my "BUJU" (I.E bullet journal)It's sturdyThe pages are like a nice beige-white colorHas a section for a table of contents for your journalPaper is nice and thick, thinker than a leuchtturm1917 A5 journal, whose GSM is usually 100 gsm. Whereas this book is 120 gsm.The pages are all numberedHas 2 bookmarkedA pen loop holderAnd another ribbon to hold the book togetherAnd a slot in the back for loose notesI got the 2 journals for $16 on sale here on Amazon and I already want to stock up on more because I KNOW I will be repurchasing more in the future as these journals get filled.I was not paid or compensated or requested to leave a review but decided to do so anyway because of the quality of these journals. Nonetheless, I would be MORE than happy if the company hooked me up with a couple journals because I truly am in love with these notebooks!!! yayyy!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: *The color is vibrant*the book is bound beautifully*The pages are excellent- I have written, stamped and painted on them and they really hold up nicely.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars nice bullet grid journal
reviews.reviewText: I love the sturdy leather covered journal and use it for daily to-do lists among other things, but not necessarily as a "bullet journal". The paper is sturdy, smooth, does not bleed through when I doodle while making lists, and it has plenty of pages to last me a long time. I like that the pocket on the inside back cover holds my metal journal rulers and that there are 2 book page markers instead of 1. My only complaint is that one of the two, the front cover has a gouge in the leather that is very noticeable. It kind of detracts from its high-quality leather. Other than that, I would have given it a 5-star rating. I will buy these again for sure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality, paper, and form factor
reviews.reviewText: This journal is as good as the name-brand, high-end journals I've purchased in the past. Paper is great for various ink types, it's smooth, and the overall book has all the features of others. The main things I wanted was dot grid with numbered pages, which can be hard to find without costing a lot more. Plus, you get two journals for less than the price of others.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I will continue to buy and fill up these journals
reviews.reviewText: I’ve bought these journals for about 4 years now to use for school and everyday stuff, and plan to continue to do so. The addition of a Content section and numbered pages is great. Though I think the pages are ever so slightly thinner now, it’s not a problem. The page quality is still great, and the binding now feels even more flush. I will forever recommend these journals.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I didn't expect such great quality and details. There is a pocket in the back! Two ribbons to mark your spot and elastic closure. I've bought sooo many journals but these are my new favs!!
La calidad de la libreta es muy buen… me encantó lo bien que se ve la cubierta y además trae varios aditamentos que no esperaba, lo recomiendo
Trabajos bien hechos y incluyen plantillas, eso está bien

reviews.reviewTitle: Descripción incorrecta del producto (cada libreta tiene 150 páginas)
reviews.reviewText: En la descripción dice que cada libreta tiene 320 páginas, pero no es cierto es entre las dos. Cada una una trae 150. Me tuve que quedar con ellas porque me urgían. De todo lo demás, la calidad es buena.

Es un excelente producto! el gramaje de las hojas es alto y eso ayuda mucho a que si se usan plumones no se tras pase la tinta a la otra hoja. el precio es excelente y la calidad de los Journals es en verdad muy buena. Lo recomiendo mucho
Me llegó antes de lo previsto. Se siente de buena calidad y si usas pluma fuente te gustará. Yo uso una lamy safary de punta media y la tinta no transpasa la hoja.
